pr_title: decrease the number of line/column calculations

timeline.message:
decrease the number of line/column calculations

precompute them just once for all sentences, not for each rule afresh
use this data to speedup text-level match anchoring

timeline.bodyText: This operator is not very common, could you add a comment?
timeline.author: danielnaber

replies.bodyText: It's inspired by JDK code, but indeed, this could be simplified. Will do!
replies.author: donnerpeter

timeline.bodyText: Here's an inconsistency. Some clients expect column to be 0-based (as in javadoc) and some — 1-based. From the history I've seen that the similar condition in the previous version of code was a hack to make some tests happy (since they're using deprecated API anyway), so I've decided to create an equivalent.
timeline.author: donnerpeter

replies.bodyText: Line/column information is deprecated in LT, we don't show it anymore in the JSON response (our main use case), we just keep it running for the command-line LT.
replies.author: danielnaber

replies.bodyText: I'd prefer to have it removed, but I see the line number is useful when running LT on the command-line, so it would need to be calculated somewhere else (maybe not in JLanguageTool). But I have no plans to work on this.
replies.author: danielnaber

replies.bodyText: Do you mean only org.languagetool.commandline.Main or anything else? If the former, I think this calculation could be moved there relatively easily, and JLanguageTool could become free of this logic, and maybe even faster.
replies.author: donnerpeter

replies.bodyText: I haven't checked closely, but yes, org.languagetool.commandline.Main sounds like the logical place for this code.
replies.author: danielnaber

replies.bodyText: I can also see some column usages in XML serialization, Wikipedia and UI HTML. I don't know of their importance nowadays. But maybe I'll take a look at this some day :)
replies.author: donnerpeter

timeline.message: binary search: make division by 2 more obvious
